precautions: Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.

Others may include digestive problems , i.e. bloating, gas, diarrhea, constipation, gerd (gastroesophageal reflux disease), nausea, and vomiting, etc. Consult a doctor, if you have hypersensitivity to any of its ingredients.

title: Ascard 75MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details:
Ascard tablet is composed of Aspirin 75 mg. Ascard is normally used as a pain killer to treat body pain, headache, toothache, and menstrual cramps. Additionally, it is also used to reduce inflammation of body joints and muscles. 

READ MORE
precautions: Medicines should be kept out of reach of children.The risk of allergic reactions may increase after using this medicine.In the case of pregnancy and breastfeeding, consult your doctor first before using this medicine. This medicine might also increase heavy menstrual bleeding. Younger adults and children may develop Reye's syndrome. Before starting to use this medicine, inform your doctor about any of the following prevailing medical health conditionsheart failure/heart problems kidney failureblood clotting disorderstomach ulcersallergy to NSAIDs asthmaindigestion People with kidney and liver problems are at a higher chance of getting side effects. Always take this medicine after having a meal.
effects: This medicine might cause intestinal and stomach bleeding. It can also cause bronchospasmIndigestion problemsFast heartbeatSkin rashstomach upsetAllergic reactionsHaemorrhage (bleeding).Younger children are at higher risk of side effects due to the use of this medicine. This medicine does not cause any side effects in most people but in case of any alarming situation, seek medical care immediately.

precautions: Some of the Loprin precautions as described below. READ MORE
precautions: Do not take a Noclot tablet if you have severe liver conditions such as impairment in the liver or active bleeding. Do not take this medicine if you have bleeding in the internal organs or if you have a severe heart impairment. Do not take this medicine on your own. This is only to be used with a prescription as it contains some serious after-effects. Do not take this a few days after a heart attack. Patients should be strictly under observation while kept on this medication.Consult your doctor before taking this medicine if you are pregnant or breastfeeding. Avoid the consumption of grapefruit if your doctor has prescribed you this medicine as the use of grapefruit can increase the risk of its side effects. Use with caution having bleeding conditions (such as stomach ulcers, bleeding in the brain/eye), Recent surgery, Serious injury/trauma, Liver disease, Hemophilia.
effects: Some side effects of Noclot tablet are bleeding, disturbance in the nervous system, disorders associated with the liver, disorders in the immunity-making cells of the body, allergic reaction, or rash on different parts of the body. Some patients might also feel gastrointestinal disorders such as diarrhea, constipation, stomach pain, vomiting, or nausea.Some very rare side effects associated with Noclot tablet are blood in urine, change in the color of stools, mainly black or dark-colored stools, vomiting with bleeding. precautions: Plavix tablet precautions are following.Before taking the Plavix tablet, inform the doctor If you have a hypersensitivity problem from the ingredients used in this medicine.About your medical history. Also, inform the doctor about the heart problems, kidney and liver problems if you have them.About the prescription that you may be taking at the same time. Otherwise, the risk of interaction will increase, which may lead to severe side effects.If you have an allergic problem from the ingredients used in this medicine.If you have the problem of bleeding disorders. If you are suffering from a stomach ulcer or intestine ulcer.If you have a bleeding problem in your brain or suffering from a head injury.Do not stop taking this medicine unless your doctor advises you. It is suggested that even you have a bleeding problem, then you should first talk to your doctor and then follow his advice.If your dental surgery work is near, then inform the doctor. He will suggest you postpone the surgery.Breastfeeding and nursing mothers should not take this medicine.Plavix tablets in pregnancy should be used with the consultation of your doctor.Alcohol should not be consumed while taking this medicine.Avoid doing activities that increase the risks of bleeding in your body.Use with caution having bleeding conditions (such as stomach ulcers, bleeding in the brain/eye), Recent surgery, Serious injury/trauma, Liver disease, Hemophilia.
effects: Plavix tablet side effects are listed.The common side effects of Plavix tablets are pale skin, yellowing of eyes, irregular or fast heartbeat problems, and low sugar levels in the blood.It can also cause headaches, seizures, no urination problems, and feeling tired and lazy.Plavix tablet increases the risk and side effect of bleeding that is a life-threatening severe side effect. Easy bleeding or bruising, Stomach upset, Diarrhea and Constipation.

title: Warfin 5MG Tab 10x10 (L)
details: Warfarin is used to treat or prevent blood clots in veins or arteries, which can reduce the risk of stroke, heart attack, or other serious conditions.
precautions: Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of blood disorders (such as anemia, hemophilia), bleeding problems (such as bleeding of the stomach/intestines, bleeding in the brain), blood vessel disorders (such as aneurysms), recent major injury/surgery, kidney disease, liver disease, alcohol use, mental/mood disorders(including memory problems), frequent falls/injuries. Warfarin can cause very serious (possibly fatal) bleeding. This is more likely to occur when you first start taking this medication or if you take too much warfarin. To decrease your risk for bleeding, your doctor or other health care provider will monitor you closely and check your lab results (INR test) to make sure you are not taking too much warfarin. Keep all medical and laboratory appointments. Tell your doctor right away if you notice any signs of serious bleeding. See also Side Effects section. This medication can cause heavy bleeding. To lower the chance of getting cut, bruised, or injured, use great caution with sharp objects like safety razors and nail cutters. Use an electric razor when shaving and a soft toothbrush when brushing your teeth. Avoid activities such as contact sports. If you fall or injure yourself, especially if you hit your head, call your doctor right away. Your doctor may need to check you. Very small amounts of this medication may pass into breast milk but is unlikely to harm a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Some products that may interact with this drug include capecitabine, imatinib, mifepristone. Aspirin, aspirin-like drugs (salicylates), and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs such as ibuprofen, naproxen, celecoxib) may have effects similar to warfarin. These drugs may increase the risk of bleeding problems if taken during treatment with warfarin. Carefully check all prescription/nonprescription product labels (including drugs applied to the skin such as pain-relieving creams) since the products may contain NSAIDs or salicylates. Talk to your doctor about using a different medication (such as acetaminophen) to treat pain/fever. Low-dose aspirin and related drugs (such as clopidogrel, ticlopidine) should be continued if prescribed by your doctor for specific medical reasons such as heart attack or stroke prevention. Consult your doctor or pharmacist for more details. Many herbal products interact with warfarin. Tell your doctor before taking any herbal products, especially bromelains, coenzyme Q10, danshen, dong quai, fenugreek, garlic, ginkgo biloba, ginseng, and St. John's wort, among others. This drug is known to cause issues during pregnancy, therefore please do not take this drug if you are pregnant.
effects: Red or brown urine, Black or bloody stool, Severe headache or stomach pain, Joint pain, discomfort or swelling, especially after an injury.

title: Clexane 40MG Inj 1x2 (L)
details: It is used to treat Venous Thromboembolism and Heart attack.
precautions: Tell your Doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Artificial heart valve(s), Kidney disease, Liver disease, Bleeding(such as low platelet counts), Low platelet counts after previous heparin treatment, Stroke, Hypertension, certain Eye problems (such as diabetic retinopathy), Stomach/Intestinal problems (such as active or recent ulcers), Recent spinal procedure or puncture, Spine problems (such as spinal deformity), Recent Eye/Brain/Spinal cord surgery.
effects: Mild irritation, Pain, Bruising, Redness, and Swelling at the injection site may occur. Fatigue or fever may also occur.

title: Disprin 300MG Tab 10x60 (L)
details: This medication is used to treat Blood Clot or Pain Relief or Thrombotic Disorder.
precautions: Use With Caution during use of other NSAIDS, having Bleeding or Blood-clotting disorders (such as Hemophilia, Vitamin K deficiency, Low platelet count).
effects: Upset stomach, Heartburn, Nausea, Vomiting.

title: Virata 90MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: Ticagrelor is used along with low-dose aspirin to help prevent heart attack and stroke.
precautions: Consult a doctor, if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.
effects: Shortness of breath, Headache, Dizziness, Nausea and Nosebleed.

title: Anplag 90MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: Ticagrelor is used along with low-dose aspirin to help prevent heart attack and stroke.
precautions: Use with caution having bleeding problems, Gout, Liver disease, Recent surgery, Serious injury or trauma, Irregular heartbeat.
effects: Shortness of breath, Headache, Dizziness, Nausea and Nosebleed.

title: Clexane 60MG Inj 1x2 (L)
details: It is used to treat Venous Thromboembolism and Heart attack.
precautions: Tell your Doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Artificial heart valve(s), Kidney disease, Liver disease, Bleeding(such as low platelet counts), Low platelet counts after previous heparin treatment, Stroke, Hypertension, certain Eye problems (such as diabetic retinopathy), Stomach/Intestinal problems (such as active or recent ulcers), Recent spinal procedure or puncture, Spine problems (such as spinal deformity), Recent Eye/Brain/Spinal cord surgery.
effects: Mild irritation, Pain, Bruising, Redness, and Swelling at the injection site may occur. Fatigue or fever may also occur.

title: Bilinta 90MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: Ticagrelor is used along with low-dose aspirin to help prevent heart attack and stroke.
precautions: Use with caution having bleeding problems, Gout, Liver disease, Recent surgery, Serious injury or trauma, Irregular heartbeat.
effects: Shortness of breath, Headache, Dizziness, Nausea and Nosebleed.

title: Clexane 80MG Inj 1x2 (L)
details: It is used to treat Venous Thromboembolism and Heart attack.
precautions: Tell your Doctor/Pharmacist your medical history, especially of Artificial heart valve(s), Kidney disease, Liver disease, Bleeding(such as low platelet counts), Low platelet counts after previous heparin treatment, Stroke, Hypertension, certain Eye problems (such as diabetic retinopathy), Stomach/Intestinal problems (such as active or recent ulcers), Recent spinal procedure or puncture, Spine problems (such as spinal deformity), Recent Eye/Brain/Spinal cord surgery.
effects: Mild irritation, Pain, Bruising, Redness, and Swelling at the injection site may occur. Fatigue or fever may also occur.

title: Xarelto 10MG Tab 1x5 (L)
details: It is used to treat Thrombotic disorders and prevent Blood Clots.
precautions: Use with caution having Liver disease, Kidney disease, Bleeding problems, Stroke, Recent major injury or surgery, Anemia, Hemophilia, Thrombocytopenia, Retinopathy, Galactose intolerance, Glucose-galactose malabsorption.
effects: Nosebleed and bleeding from cuts may increase.

title: Pletaal 50MG Tab 10x10 (L)
details: It is used to improve the symptoms of a certain blood flow problem in the legs (intermittent claudication). Cilostazol can decrease the muscle pain/cramps that occur during exercise/walking.
precautions: Before taking cilostazol, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of serious/active bleeding (such as bleeding ulcers, bleeding in the eye/brain), blood disorders(such as hemophilia, low platelet counts), heart disease (such as heart attack, chest pain, fast/irregular heartbeat), stroke, kidney disease. Medications similar to cilostazol have caused serious (possibly fatal) problems in people with a certain type of heart disease (heart failure). Therefore, do not use cilostazol if you have heart failure. It is unknown if this medication passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding.Some products that may interact with this drug include "blood thinners" (such as heparin, warfarin), certain other antiplatelet drugs (such as dipyridamole), tipranavir.Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Headache, diarrhea, runny nose, and dizziness may occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Xarelto 15MG Tab 2x7 (L)
details: It is used to treat Thrombotic disorders and prevent Blood Clots.
precautions: Use with caution having Liver disease, Kidney disease, Bleeding problems, Stroke, Recent major injury or surgery, Anemia, Hemophilia, Thrombocytopenia, Retinopathy, Galactose intolerance, Glucose-galactose malabsorption.
effects: Nosebleed and bleeding from cuts may increase.
